title: Software Engineer
Senior Mechanical Developer
description:
**About the job** 




  





 MY01 Inc. is seeking a highly skilled and experienced
 **Senior Mechanical Developer** 
 to play a pivotal role in our regulatory initiatives. The successful candidate will lead the mechanical design and development of MY01's product. The ideal candidate will demonstrate meticulous attention to detail, adaptability to new environments and challenges, and a commitment to our core values of
 *trust, responsibility,  compassion, curiosity, and accountability* 
 .
 



  





 In this role, you will gain valuable experience in a fast\\-moving, collaborative, and high\\-performing startup environment while leading a team of highly skilled and knowledgeable individuals. The
 **Senior Mechanical Developer** 
 will report directly to the
 **Director of NPI and Sustaining Engineering** 
 and will work a total of 40 hours per week.
 



  





 If you are a motivated and experienced
 **Senior Mechanical Developer** 
 professional looking to join a dynamic team at the forefront of medical innovation, we encourage you to apply for the
 **Senior Mechanical Developer** 
  position at MY01 Inc.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




  




* Lead the mechanical design and development of MY01's medical devices, including parts, components, and subsystems.
* Generate detailed part drawings and manufacturing plans optimized for cost\\-effectiveness and efficient production.
* Conduct and lead design reviews, ensuring designs meet functional, regulatory, and manufacturing requirements.
* Collaborate with suppliers to create, assemble, and test functional prototypes, ensuring seamless integration of components.
* Apply design for manufacturability (DFM) principles to ensure products can be successfully transferred to production, focusing on cost reduction and process optimization.
* Demonstrate compliance with applicable medical device standards through verification and validation (V\\&V) testing.
* Oversee and execute compliance testing for biomedical products, ensuring adherence to safety and performance standards.
* Prepare, review, and publish test protocols, test reports, and complex mechanical analyses.
* Communicate with external test facilities to generate and execute comprehensive testing plans.
* Analyze and process data using advanced statistical analyses and modeling tools to optimize designs and predict performance.
* Serve as a key contributor to product development projects and initiatives, providing technical expertise and guidance.
* Develop tools and jigs for the manufacturing team to improve production efficiency and quality.



  





**Qualifications** 




  




* M.Sc. or B.Sc. in Mechanical Engineering or a related field.
* Minimum of 5\\-7 years of experience in mechanical design and development, preferably in the medical device industry.
* Proven expertise in applying fundamental mechanical engineering principles, including statics, dynamics, mechanics of materials, fluid mechanics, and thermodynamics.
* Strong analytical skills with proficiency in statistical analysis, design of experiments (DOE), and modeling techniques.
* Proficiency in 3D CAD software (preferably Autodesk Inventor), for complex part and assembly design.
* Experience with generating detailed mechanical drawings and GD\\&T (Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing).
* Experience with data analysis tools such as Minitab, MATLAB, Python, or statistical software packages.
* In\\-depth understanding of various manufacturing processes, including machining, molding, casting, and assembly, with a focus on design for manufacturability (DFM) and design for assembly (DFA).
* Demonstrated ability to apply cost\\-effective design principles and optimize designs for production efficiency.
* Knowledge of medical device regulations and standards, such as ISO 13485 and FDA guidelines.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary team.
* Strong organizational and note\\-taking skills.
* Ability to multitask and manage multiple complex projects simultaneously.



  





***Applicants are encouraged to apply even if they don’t meet ALL the criteria listed above.***




  





**BENEFITS \\& PERKS** 




  





 MY01 prioritizes team well\\-being and satisfaction, offering:
 



  




* **Convenient Location:** 
 Downtown Montreal, next to Place Des Arts metro.
* **Comprehensive Benefits:** 
 Group plan and a wellness allowance.
* **Flexible Work:** 
 Hybrid model (3/week in\\-office) \\& flexible scheduling.
* **Generous Time Off** 
 plus a year\\-end holiday closure.
* **Ownership Opportunity:** 
 Employee Stock Option Plan.
* **Further Education Support.**
* **Office Perks:** 
 Complimentary snacks, break room with games, and a fully equipped kitchen.
* **Team Events:** 
 Regular social gatherings, quarterly events, and an annual retreat.



  





*MY01 Inc. is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We are committed to creating a work environment based on mutual respect, hard work and inclusion without bias or discrimination. Our team is made up of people from all backgrounds and walks of life, and each member is valued for what they know and what they can contribute. As a collective we are continuously learning and encourage each other to push our boundaries and make mistakes we can all learn from. Those who do so will get an opportunity to grow with us and share in our success.* 




  





 \\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_
 



  





**A PROPOS DU RÔLE** 




  





 MY01 Inc. est à la recherche d'un
 
**Concepteur Mécanique Sénior** 

 hautement qualifié et expérimenté pour diriger nos initiatives en matière de réglementation et de qualité. Le candidat retenu jouera un rôle essentiel en assurant la conformité aux exigences réglementaires  au sein de MY01 Inc. Le candidat idéal fera preuve d'une attention méticuleuse aux détails, d'une capacité d'adaptation à de nouveaux environnements et défis, et d'un engagement envers nos valeurs fondamentales de confiance, de responsabilité, de compassion, de curiosité et d'obligation de rendre compte.
 



  





 Dans ce rôle, vous acquerrez une expérience précieuse dans un environnement de startup en évolution rapide, collaboratif et performant.
 
 Le
 **Concepteur Mécanique Sénior** 
 se rapportera directement au
 **Directeur, NPI et Sustaining Engineering** 
 et travaillera pour un total de 40 heures par semaine.
 



  





 Si vous êtes un professionnel motivé et expérimenté en conception mécanique et que vous souhaitez rejoindre une équipe dynamique à la pointe de l'innovation médicale, nous vous encourageons à postuler pour le poste de
 **Concepteur Mécanique Sénior** 
 chez MY01 Inc.
 



  





**Responsabilités** 




  




* Mener la conception mécanique et le développement des dispositifs médicaux.
* Créer des dessins détaillés de pièces et des plans de fabrication.
* Mener des revues de conception pour s'assurer que les exigences sont satisfaites.
* Collaborer avec les fournisseurs sur le prototypage et l'intégration des composants.
* Appliquer les principes de DFM (conception pour la fabrication) pour le transfert de production et l'optimisation.
* Assurer la conformité aux normes des dispositifs médicaux grâce aux tests de V\\&V (vérification et validation).
* Superviser les tests de conformité pour les produits biomédicaux.
* Préparer et publier les protocoles et rapports d'essais.
* Communiquer avec les installations d'essais externes pour les plans d'essais.
* Analyser les données à l'aide d'outils statistiques pour l'optimisation de la conception.
* Fournir une expertise technique aux projets de développement de produits.
* Développer des outils et des gabarits pour la fabrication.



  





**Qualifications** 




  




* Baccalauréat ou maîtrise en génie mécanique ou dans un domaine connexe.
* Au moins 5 à 7 ans d'expérience en conception et développement mécaniques, de préférence dans l'industrie des dispositifs médicaux.
* Expertise avérée dans l'application des principes fondamentaux de l'ingénierie mécanique, notamment les statistiques, la dynamique, la mécanique des matériaux, la mécanique des fluides et la thermodynamique.
* Solides compétences analytiques avec maîtrise de l'analyse statistique, de la conception d'expériences (DOE) et des techniques de modélisation.
* Maîtrise des logiciels de CAO 3D (de préférence Autodesk Inventor) pour la conception de pièces et d'assemblages complexes.
* Expérience de la production de dessins mécaniques détaillés et de la GD\\&T (Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing).
* Expérience des outils d'analyse de données tels que Minitab, MATLAB, Python ou des progiciels statistiques.
* Compréhension approfondie des différents processus de fabrication, notamment l'usinage, le moulage, la coulée et l'assemblage, avec un accent particulier sur la conception pour la fabrication (DFM) et la conception pour l'assemblage (DFA).
* Capacité avérée à appliquer des principes de conception rentables et à optimiser les conceptions en vue de l'efficacité de la production.
* Connaissance des réglementations et des normes relatives aux dispositifs médicaux, telles que la norme ISO 13485 et les directives de la FDA.
* Excellentes aptitudes à la communication et à la collaboration, avec la capacité de travailler efficacement au sein d'une équipe pluridisciplinaire.
* Solides compétences en matière d'organisation et de prise de notes.
* Capacité à mener plusieurs tâches de front et à gérer simultanément plusieurs projets complexes.



  





***Les candidats sont encouragés à postuler même s'ils ne répondent pas à TOUS les critères énumérés ci\\-dessus.***




  





**AVANTAGES ET BÉNÉFICES** 




  





 MY01 accorde la priorité au bien\\-être et à la satisfaction de son équipe, en offrant:
 



  




* **Emplacement idéal:** 
  Centre\\-ville de Montréal, à côté du métro Place des Arts.
* **Avantages sociaux complets:** 
  Régime collectif et allocation de bien\\-être.
* **Travail flexible:** 
  Modèle hybride (3j x sem) \\& horaires flexibles.
* **Congés généreux** 
 plus une fermeture des bureaux à la fin de l'année.
* **Opportunité de participation:** 
  Plan d'options d'achat d'actions pour les employés.
* **Soutien à la formation continue.**
* **Avantages au bureau:** 
  Collations gratuites, salle de pause avec jeux et cuisine entièrement équipée.
* **Événements d'équipe:** 
  Rassemblements sociaux réguliers, événements trimestriels et une retraite annuelle.

title: Senior Software Engineer, LearnwithAI (Remote) - $100,000/year USD
description:
Are you ready to revolutionize education with AI? At LearnWith.AI, we're not just dreaming about the future of learning—we're building it. In a world where generic educational content falls flat, we're pioneering AI\\-driven systems that create dynamic, personalized learning experiences at scale.
 



 Imagine an AI\\-powered "Second Brain" for subjects like Science or History—a smart knowledge hub that crafts engaging, adaptive content tailored to each student's needs. This isn't science fiction; it's what we're bringing to life, and we need your expertise to make it happen.
 



 As our new Senior Software Engineer, you won't be confined to conventional coding tasks. You'll be at the forefront of innovation, designing AI\\-powered workflows that redefine how students learn. This role is for those who dare to think big, who see AI not just as a tool, but as a catalyst for transforming education.
 



 If you're passionate about leveraging cutting\\-edge technology to create meaningful impact, if you're excited by the challenge of making learning more accessible, effective, and enjoyable for students worldwide, then this is your calling. Join us in reshaping the educational landscape—one AI\\-generated lesson at a time.
 



  





**What you will be doing** 







* Architect the Future of Learning: Design and implement AI\\-driven educational tools that push the boundaries of personalized learning.
* Craft Intelligent Knowledge Hubs: Leverage Large Language Models (LLMs) to build contextual knowledge packs and "Second Brains" for various subjects.
* Engineer Smart Workflows: Integrate diverse AI tools, craft ingenious prompts, and refine processes based on expert feedback and user insights.
* Build Scalable Foundations: Design and implement robust data structures that provide contextual support for our AI\\-driven business logic.



  





**Key Responsibilities** 







* Spearhead LearnWith.AI's mission to stand out in the EdTech landscape by developing AI\\-powered systems that generate captivating, student\\-specific educational content.
* Collaborate with cross\\-functional teams to ensure our AI\\-generated materials are not only engaging but also pedagogically sound and aligned with educational standards.
* Continuously innovate and optimize our AI workflows, staying at the cutting edge of AI and machine learning advancements in education.



  





**Candidate Requirements** 







* Proven track record with 2\\+ years of experience as a software engineer, demonstrating a knack for innovative problem\\-solving.
* Master's Degree or higher in Mathematics, Science, English Literature, Computer Science, Economics, or History. Your advanced knowledge will be crucial in developing sophisticated educational content.
* Hands\\-on experience utilizing AI tools like ChatGPT, Gemini, or Grok in professional settings. You should be comfortable pushing these tools to their limits and beyond.
* Passion for education and a vision for how AI can transform learning experiences.
* Strong communication skills to collaborate effectively with educators, subject matter experts, and fellow engineers.



  





**This position is also known as:** 



* Artificial Intelligence Engineer
* Full Stack Engineer
* Senior AI Engineer

title: Senior Data Scientist - Power Trading
description:
CWP Energy Solutions delivers value to renewable power generators by de\\-risking their business and stabilizing their returns. Using cutting\\-edge technology, proprietary data and deep power markets expertise, our data\\-driven platform gives our partners the tools and intelligence to optimize the sale and purchase of their electricity while managing risks from growing grid intermittency.  We partner with renewable energy generators across North America operating in deregulated power markets who seek to maximize the returns on their solar, wind and battery storage investments.
   

 We are proud of our entrepreneurial approach that encourages initiative, experimentation and risk taking. This role is a great opportunity for an individual who wants to create value in an organization that has limited red tape and join a team that operates in a startup\\-like environment.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities** 
* Develop and implement machine learning models for electricity price forecasting and energy market predictions.
* Design and optimize data models, algorithms, and analytics to extract actionable insights from power markets.
* Conduct time series analysis and apply regularization techniques to improve model performance under real\\-world conditions and uncertainty.
* Analyze day\\-ahead and real\\-time market dynamics, including demand, supply, congestion, transmission constraints, renewables, and generation outages.
* Build and deploy predictive models to support electricity trading decisions and risk management strategies.
* Develop automated tools and dashboards using SQL and Python to enhance data accessibility and decision\\-making.
* Prepare and present reports, forecasts, and recommendations to internal and external stakeholders.
* Research and apply advanced statistical and machine learning techniques to refine forecasting models and develop data monetization strategies.


**What We're Looking For** 
* 3\\-5 years of experience in a data science role, with a strong focus on machine learning and predictive modeling.
* Autonomous and proactive mindset – we need someone who goes beyond plug\\-and\\-play solutions and actively builds and optimizes models.
* Strong programming skills in Python and SQL
* Knowledge of machine learning models, including Random Forest and XGBoost.
* Strong communication skills – ability to explain and synthesize complex concepts to both technical and non\\-technical audiences.
* Ability to work independently, take initiative, and propose new data\\-driven strategies.
* Experience in time series forecasting and applying machine learning techniques to real\\-world market problems.
* Knowledge of North American power markets (RTO/ISO) is an asset.
* Fluent in English; French is a plus.


**What We Offer** 
* A dynamic environment that encourages initiative and experimentation.
* A results\\-driven corporate culture.
* Full group insurance and an RRSP contribution program.
* Vacation policy from day one.
* Public transit incentive program.
* Give \\& Match program.
* Flexible hours and hybrid work options.
* A modern office with a gym, lounge, locker rooms, and showers.


  

 Are you looking to have a direct impact on the growth of a fast\\-moving company and work on complex modeling and market prediction challenges? Join us!
   

  

*We collect your information via a secure applicant tracking system, where access is restricted according to the position. Data, including CVs and interview notes, are stored in this system. If you have any objections or wish to withdraw your consent, please contact us at talent@mcgillstlaurent.com.* 
  

  
 

 \\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_
   

  
 

  

 CWP Energy Solutions se positionne auprès des générateurs d'énergies renouvelables en réduisant les risques de leurs activités et en stabilisant leurs revenus. Grâce à des technologies de pointe, à un large répertoire de données exclusives et à une expertise approfondie des marchés de l'énergie, notre plateforme fournit à nos partenaires les outils et l'intelligence de marché nécessaires pour optimiser la vente et l'achat de leur électricité tout en gérant les risques liés à l'intermittence croissante du réseau.  Nous travaillons en partenariat avec des producteurs d'énergie renouvelable à travers l'Amérique du Nord qui opèrent sur des marchés déréglementés et qui cherchent à maximiser le rendement de leurs investissements en énergie solaire et éolienne ainsi qu’en stockage de batterie.
   

 Nous sommes fiers de notre approche entrepreneuriale qui encourage l'initiative, l'expérimentation et la prise de risque. Ce poste est une excellente occasion de créer de la valeur dans une organisation où l'aspect administratif est limité et est idéal pour une personne qui aspire à opérer dans un environnement de type startup.
   

  

**Responsabilités principales :** 
* Développer et mettre en œuvre des modèles de machine learning pour la prévision des prix de l’électricité et des marchés de l’énergie.
* Concevoir et optimiser des modèles de données, des algorithmes et des analyses afin d’extraire des informations exploitables sur les marchés de l’électricités.
* Réaliser des analyses de séries temporelles et appliquer des techniques de régularisation pour améliorer la performance des modèles dans des conditions réelles et incertaines.
* Analyser les dynamiques des marchés de l’électricité Day\\-Ahead et Real\\-Time, y compris la demande, l’offre, la congestion, les contraintes de transmission, les énergies renouvelables et les pannes de production.
* Construire et déployer des modèles prédictifs pour soutenir les décisions de trading de l’électricité et les stratégies de gestion des risques.
* Développer des outils automatisés et des tableaux de bord pour améliorer l’accès aux données et soutenir la prise de décision.
* Préparer et présenter des rapports, des prévisions et des recommandations aux parties prenantes internes et externes.
* Rechercher et appliquer des techniques statistiques avancées et d’apprentissage automatique pour affiner les modèles de prévision et développer des stratégies de monétisation des données.


**Profil recherché** 
* 3 à 5 ans d'expérience dans un rôle de scientifique des données, avec un accent marqué sur l'apprentissage automatique et la modélisation prédictive.
* Esprit autonome et proactif – nous recherchons une personne qui dépasse les solutions toutes faites et qui construit et optimise activement les modèles.
* Solides compétences en programmation Python et SQL.
* Connaissance des modèles d'apprentissage automatique, y compris Random Forest et XGBoost.
* Excellentes compétences en communication – capacité à expliquer et à synthétiser des concepts complexes auprès de publics techniques et non techniques.
* Capacité à travailler de manière autonome, à prendre des initiatives et à proposer de nouvelles stratégies basées sur les données.
* Expérience en prévision de séries temporelles et dans l'application des techniques d'apprentissage automatique à des problématiques réelles du marché.
* Connaissance des marchés de l'électricité en Amérique du Nord (RTO/ISO), un atout.
* Maîtrise de l'anglais ; le français est un plus.


**Ce que nous offrons** 
* Un environnement dynamique où l’initiative et l’expérimentation sont encouragées.
* Une culture d’entreprise axée sur les résultats.
* Assurance collective complète et programme de cotisation REER.
* Politique de congés dès l’entrée en poste.
* Programme d’incitatif au transport en commun.
* Programme Give \\& Match.
* Horaires flexibles et télétravail hybride.
* Un bureau moderne avec gym, lounge, vestiaires et douches.


  

 Tu veux avoir un impact direct sur la croissance d’une entreprise en pleine expansion et travailler sur des problématiques complexes de modélisation et de prédiction des marchés ? Rejoins\\-nous !
   

  

*Nous recueillons vos informations via un système de suivi des candidats sécurisé, où l'accès est restreint selon le poste. Les données, incluant CVs et notes d'entretiens, sont conservées dans ce système. Pour tout désaccord ou retrait de consentement, contactez\\-nous à talent@mcgillstlaurent.com.*

title: Administrateur système et réseau – Infogérance Clients
description:
**À propos de nous** 
  

 Depuis plus de 30 ans, Images \\& Technologie est un leader canadien en solutions TI. Nous concevons, développons et déployons des infrastructures de calcul haute performance et d’IA pour divers secteurs : médias et divertissement, science des données, apprentissage automatique, santé, gouvernement, éducation, recherche avancée, ainsi qu’architecture, ingénierie et construction. En plus de nos solutions infonuagiques (CaaS) et centre de données (DCaaS), nous offrons des services TI gérés pour les PME. 
 



**Rôle: Administrateur système et réseau – Infogérance Clients (Montréal)** 




**Description du poste** 
  

 Nous recherchons un Administrateur système et réseau pour rejoindre notre équipe en charge de l’infogérance de divers clients à Montréal. Vous serez responsable de l’administration, du support et de l’optimisation des infrastructures IT des clients, en collaboration avec une équipe technique expérimentée. Ce poste implique des déplacements chez les clients. 
 



**Responsabilités principales** 



* Gérer l’infogérance de plusieurs clients en collaboration avec l’équipe technique.
* Assurer la gestion et la maintenance des environnements de virtualisation (Hyper\\-V, Proxmox, VMware).
* Administrer et optimiser les services Microsoft 365 (Exchange, SharePoint, Teams, OneDrive).
* Gérer et maintenir les systèmes d’exploitation Windows Server et intervenir sur les postes de travail Windows.
* Administrer et sécuriser les infrastructures réseaux avec WatchGuard et Meraki.
* Mettre en place et superviser des stratégies de sauvegarde et de reprise après sinistre.
* Assurer un support technique efficace auprès des clients et garantir un excellent service.
* Effectuer des déplacements réguliers pour des interventions sur site.



**Profil recherché** 



* Expérience en infogérance et administration système/réseau.
* Maîtrise des solutions réseau WatchGuard et Meraki.
* Expérience avec les environnements de virtualisation Hyper\\-V, Proxmox, VMware, solution de stockage.
* Bonne connaissance de Microsoft 365, Azure et des environnements Windows Server.
* Connaissances en Linux appréciées.
* Excellentes compétences en travail d’équipe et service client.
* Bilingue français / anglais obligatoire.
* Permis de conduire valide obligatoire pour les déplacements clients.



**Nous offrons** 



* Travail en équipe avec des projets variés et stimulants
* Des opportunités de développement professionnel
* 37,5 heures/ semaine
* Véhicule corporatif fourni pour les déplacements clients
* RVER dès le premier jour
* Assurance collective
* Ambiance collaborative, bien que ce ne soit pas un avantage, c’est une évidence
* Un comité social pour se gâter de temps en temps
* 3 semaines de vacances
* Le jour de ta fête offert en congé



 Rejoignez notre équipe et contribuez à la réussite technologique de nos clients PME ! Pour postuler, veuillez envoyer votre CV et une lettre de motivation à emplois@imagespc.com. 
   

  
 



 \\-
   

  
 



**About Us** 
  

 For over 30 years, Images \\& Technology has been a Canadian leader in IT solutions. We design, develop, and deploy high\\-performance computing and AI infrastructures across various industries, including Media \\& Entertainment, Data Science, Machine Learning, Healthcare, Government, Education, Advanced Research, as well as Architecture, Engineering, and Construction. In addition to our Cloud as a Service (CaaS) and Data Center as a Service (DCaaS) solutions, we provide managed IT services for SMEs. 
 



**Role: System and Network Administrator – Managed Services Clients** 




**Job Description** 
  

 We are looking for a System and Network Administrator to join our team managing IT outsourcing (managed services) for various clients in Montreal. You will be responsible for administering, supporting, and optimizing clients' IT infrastructures while working closely with an experienced technical team. This position requires on\\-site visits to clients. 
 



**Main Responsibilities** 



* Manage IT outsourcing for multiple clients in collaboration with the technical team.
* Maintain and administer virtualization environments (Hyper\\-V, Proxmox, VMware).
* Administer and optimize Microsoft 365 services (Exchange, SharePoint, Teams, OneDrive).
* Manage and maintain Windows Server operating systems and provide support for Windows workstations.
* Administer and secure network infrastructures using WatchGuard and Meraki.
* Implement and oversee backup and disaster recovery strategies.
* Provide effective technical support to clients and ensure outstanding customer service.
* Perform regular on\\-site interventions as required.



**Required Profile** 



* Experience in managed services and system/network administration.
* Proficiency in WatchGuard and Meraki network solutions.
* Experience with Hyper\\-V, Proxmox, and VMware virtualization environments, storage solutions.
* Strong knowledge of Azure,Microsoft 365 and Windows Server environments.
* Linux knowledge is a plus.
* Excellent teamwork and customer service skills.
* Bilingual (French/English) is mandatory.
* A valid driver’s license is required for client visits.



**What We Offer** 



* Team\\-oriented work environment with diverse and stimulating projects.
* Professional development opportunities
* 37\\.5 hours per week
* Company vehicle provided for client visits
* Group retirement savings plan (VRSP) from day one
* Comprehensive group insurance
* A collaborative atmosphere—more than a perk, it’s just how we work
* A social committee to treat ourselves from time to time
* 3 weeks of vacation
* Your birthday off as a paid day off



 Join our team and contribute to the technological success of our SME clients! To apply, please send your CV and cover letter to jobs@imagespc.com.

title: L2 Support Engineer
description:
Thank you for your interest in working for our Company. Recruiting the right talent is crucial to our goals. On April 1, 2024, 3M Healthcare underwent a corporate spin\\-off leading to the creation of a new company named Solventum. We are still in the process of updating our Careers Page and applicant documents, which currently have 3M branding. Please bear with us. In the interim, our Privacy Policy here: https://www.solventum.com/en\\-us/home/legal/website\\-privacy\\-statement/applicant\\-privacy/ continues to apply to any personal information you submit, and the 3M\\-branded positions listed on our Careers Page are for Solventum positions. As it was with 3M, at Solventum all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
 








**:** 








**L2 Support Engineer (Solventum)** 








**3M Healthcare is now Solventum** 








**At Solventum, we enable better, smarter, safer healthcare to improve lives. As a new company with a long legacy of creating breakthrough solutions for our customers' toughest challenges, we pioneer game\\-changing innovations at the intersection of health, material and data science that change patients' lives for the better while enabling healthcare professionals to perform at their best. Because people, and their wellbeing, are at the heart of every scientific advancement we pursue.** 








**We partner closely with the brightest minds in healthcare to ensure that every solution we create melds the latest technology with compassion and empathy. Because at Solventum, we never stop solving for you.** 








**The Impact You'll Make in this Role** 
  

 As a regional Lead on the Insider Threat team, you will conduct in\\-depth analyses of security incidents and interpret, correlate and evaluate employee related data to identify if the alerted behaviors pose a substantial risk to the enterprise. You will implement new processes and procedures as identified by the team and stakeholders to ensure continuous improvements for monitoring, detection and response capabilities. You will help lead our mission to protect Solventum by collaborating with our key stakeholders and business partners to develop new strategies for the Insider Threat program.
 







 As an L2 Support Engineer, you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world. Here, you will make an impact by:
 


* Implementing Solventum solutions for new Customers
* Developing and supporting the current or new products and features for the existing customers
* Testing and validating new features and products for the HIS division in Canada
* Training new employees or users on Solventum products
* Participating on Solventum HIS products certifications







**Your Skills and Expertise** 



* Prevent issues before they occur by documenting best practices and proactive outreach to Canadian customers for Health Information systems
* Engage with customers to resolve technical support requests efficiently and swiftly. Coordinate with cross\\-functional teams as necessary to resolve complex issues
* Serve as an advisor to clients on technical challenges, include integrations and use of 3M Health Information Systems products
* Experience in Health care and Health Information Systems
* Coordinate with Canadian and international colleagues for building, customizing and supporting 3M Health Information Systems solution
* Continually Develop and refine support processes and introduce automations to enhance efficiency and customer satisfaction







**In addition to the above requirements, the following are also required:** 




 Bachelor's Degree or higher AND (4\\) four years collaborating in a private, public, government or military environment
 



  

 OR
 







 High School Diploma/GED from an accredited institution and a minimum of (8\\) eight years collaborating in a private, public, government or military environment
 







**Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:** 



* Programming Languages



 Java, C\\+\\+, Python, C\\#, SQL, C, JavaScript, HTML, CSS
 


* RELEVANT COURSES



 Software Design, Theory of Computation, Algorithm Design, Operating Systems, Software Engineering Project, Database Systems, Artificial Intelligence, Applied Machine Learning, Software Privacy
 


* Strong analytical skills, excellent communication skills and ability to effectively collaborate with cross\\-functional teams.
* Experience with technical solutions.







**Work location:** 



* **Hybrid\\-Canada**







**Travel: May include up to** 
 15% \\[domestic/international]
 



**Relocation Assistance: Not authorized** 








**Must be legally authorized to work in country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H1B status).** 








**Supporting Your Well\\-being** 



























 La Compagnie Solventum Canada invite et encourage les personnes presentant un handicap a poser leur candidature. Des mesures d'adaptation peuvent etre prises sur demande pour les candidats qui participent a tous les aspects du processus de selection.
 








 Solventum is committed to maintaining the highest standards of integrity and professionalism in our recruitment process. Applicants must remain alert to fraudulent job postings and recruitment schemes that falsely claim to represent Solventum and seek to exploit job seekers.
 







 Please note that all email communications from Solventum regarding job opportunities with the company will be from an email with a domain of
 **@solventum.com** 
 . Be wary of unsolicited emails or messages regarding Solventum job opportunities from emails with other email domains.
 























**Please note: your application may not be considered if you do not provide your education and work history, either by: 1\\) uploading a resume, or 2\\) entering the information into the application fields directly.** 








**Solventum Global Terms of Use and Privacy Statement** 




  

 Carefully read these Terms of Use before using this website. Your access to and use of this website and application for a job at Solventum are conditioned on your acceptance and compliance with these terms.
 







 Please access the linked document by clicking here, select the country where you are applying for employment, and review. Before submitting your application you will be asked to confirm your agreement with the
   

 terms.

title: Intern, Maintenance Integration, Building & Equipment (Summer 2025)
description:
**Innovation is in our DNA... is it in yours?** 
  

 Bombardier is a global leader in aviation, creating innovative and game\\-changing planes. Our products and services provide world\\-class experiences that set new standards in passenger comfort, energy efficiency, reliability and safety. We are a global organization focused on working together with a team spirit.
 



**Your boarding pass will include...** 




 Several conferences, including:
 


* Meet An Executive
* Women Taking Flight



 Learning more about Bombardier, including:
 


* Bombardier Products conference
* Visits of the Bombardier sites
* Bombardier Academy of Learning



 Many social/networking opportunities, including:
 


* Volunteering
* Networking for Success

**What are your contributions to the team?**

**How to thrive in this role?**

*It is important to note that our internship opportunities are open to students only, not new graduates. All our interns may be required to occasionally travel outside of Canada for training/work purpose.*

title: Senior Systems Analyst
description:
Our Technology team wakes up every day with one goal in mind \\- connecting Canadians to the people and things that matter most. Together, we are proud to support 30 million Canadians each month through managing a robust portfolio that champions leading\\-edge technology. We drive large\\-scale, complex, and high\\-visibility technology projects and programs that shape the future of technology in Canada and expand connectivity from coast to coast. If you are interested in being a part of this, consider applying for the following opportunity:
 



  
 



 Are you looking for a unique opportunity in a national recognized and leading company? Are you always keeping up with the newest technologies and innovations? 
 



 Rogers is seeking for highly motivated eager to make an impact and bring a personal touch in the technology space. You'll work alongside industry professionals who will support your overall personal and professional growth in the organization to achieve our goals. As a
 **Senior System Analyst** 
 , you will participate in the evolution of our applications systems along with engaging in the delivery of high\\-quality software\\-based network monitoring solutions.
 



  
 



**What you will do:** 




 You will play an important role in implementing monitoring solutions projects and support of existing integrations on wireless and wireline technologies in collaboration with various teams across Rogers. You will integrate tools to allow network performance optimization and will deliver optimal service levels of our operations and engineering teams. Tools are integrated with the collaboration of external vendors such as OpenText, Cisco, RCATSOne, Commscope, Netscout, Gigamon, Witbe etc. as well as leveraging internally developed tools
 



 We work in an environment where everything changes rapidly. You will collaborate with external companies, engineering and operation groups, to set up network service monitoring systems as well as optimize fault visualization and identification of incident root cause.
 


* Participate in the development of a long\\-term vision and roadmap for product evolution.
* Gather and translate internal client requirements into well\\-documented solutions that align with strategic goals.
* Work closely with multidisciplinary teams to improve process efficiency and system performance.
* Integrate and administrate the different monitoring tools and develop software when required.
* Implement methodologies specific to the software development lifecycle to design and deploy monitoring solutions aligned with business needs.
* Explore and apply advanced technologies such as machine learning and AI to enhance network monitoring capabilities.



  
 



**What you bring:** 



* Fluent in English and French to communicate with our clientele
* A degree in computer science, computer engineering or equivalent experience.
* Technological knowledge including databases, SQL, Linux, Windows, Java and Python are an asset.
* Demonstrated skills in simplifying and clearly communicating complex situations.
* A creative, innovative, and automation\\-driven mindset with a strong desire to succeed.
* Passion for technology, engineering and telecommunications.
* Openness to new challenges and a willingness to continuously learn and develop new skills.
* A team\\-oriented approach, thriving in a diverse and collaborative environment.



  
 



  
 



 This is a hybrid work model in our Montreal office located in the heart of downtown Montreal,directly connected to the underground, the metro system, and the suburban trains. As the second largest building in Montreal, we are surrounded by a wide array of restaurants and shops as well. The campus isa shared space work environmentwith interactive spaces,quiet zones, and the newest technology to encouragecollaboration and enable you to come up with the most creative and refreshing solutions. 
 



 We offer constant support for your continuous growth and development, offering opportunities to move throughout the company initiatives and business priorities.
 



  
 



**To protect our people, brand and assets, a pre\\-employment background check will be conducted. As part of our selection process, all candidates must clear a criminal background check. Additionally, a credit check and drivers abstract may be required depending on the role.** 




  
 



 Schedule: Full time
   

 Shift: Day
   

 Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position)
   

 Work Location: 800, Gauchetiere O, Bureau 4000\\-Place Bonaventure \\- Montreal(182\\), Montreal, QC 
   

 Travel Requirements: Up to 10%
   

 Posting Category/Function: Technology \\& Systems Administration
   

 Requisition ID: 322776
 



  
 



  
 



 At Rogers, we believe the key to a strong business, is a diverse workforce where equity and inclusion are core to making everyone feel like they belong. We do this by embracing our diversity, celebrating our different perspectives, and working towards creating environments that empower our people to bring their whole selves to work. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential by removing any barriers for equal participation. We work with our candidates who are experiencing a disability throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You matter to us! For any questions, please visit the
 **Recruitment Process FAQ** 
 .
 



  

 Posting Notes:  Technology

title: Solutions Engineer
description:
**About the role:** 




 Sama is searching for an experienced Solutions Engineer who is excited to solve customers' most complex problems. Straddling the product and sales organizations, you will work directly with our GTM team to discover and understand customer's business needs and navigate complex sales cycles. As a technical expert, you will provide consulting expertise, value\\-based demonstrations, support enterprise Proof of Concepts, and develop custom solutions and integrations, while illustrating the value of Sama's services and solutions.
 



**Key Responsibilities:** 




**You will:** 



* Partner with Sama Account Executives and Sama Account Managers to deliver new customer pilots and grow technical relationships with existing customers.
* Lead technical scoping and requirements gathering to design complex AI data solutions for clients, providing machine learning expertise through product demos, proof\\-of\\-concepts, and workshops that align with client business objectives.
* Design, develop, and maintain demos, integrations, and other tools for executing successful pilot programs  and customer expansions.
* Become an expert in Sama products from a business and technical standpoint and maintain up\\-to\\-date knowledge of relevant industry trends and emerging technologies.
* Evangelize Sama and engage  with customers at major industry events and academic conferences.
* Partner with Product and R\\&D to influence the Product roadmap based on real\\-time industry insights.
* Collaborate with fellow  SEs and technical teams to share best practices, lessons learned, and technical insights.



**Minimum Qualifications:** 



* 2\\+ years of industry experience within  AI/ML companies.
* 4\\+ years of enterprise sales experience, including selling highly  technical solutions to both business and technical audiences.
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field, or equivalent experience.
* Strong scripting proficiency in Python.
* Knowledge of AI and hands\\-on experience with ML models, including the ability to quickly learn, understand, and work with emerging technologies, methodologies, and solutions in the AI space.
* Ability to develop and articulate AI solutions that artfully balance the symbiosis between technology and humanity while solving key business problems.
* Demonstrated leadership through strong project management, creative problem solving, and accountability of outcomes in fast\\-paced environments.
* Exhibited intellectual curiosity and empathy while thriving autonomously in ambiguous situations.



**Preferred Qualifications:** 



* Prior experience selling complex technical solutions to enterprise clients.
* Hands\\-on experience in AI, Computer Vision, or Robotics.

title: Account Development Manager - Industrial Hydraulics / Responsable du développement des comptes - Hyd
description:
### About Rexroth:



  

  


 Nos technologies d'entraînement et de contrôle garantissent l'efficacité, la puissance et la sécurité des mouvements dans les machines et les systèmes de toute taille. Nous inspirons nos clients avec des composants intelligents, des solutions de systèmes sur mesure et des services \\- des applications entièrement connectées à l'usine du futur. Bosch Rexroth se consacre à rendre le monde meilleur grâce à l'innovation et à la technologie. Nous recherchons des collaborateurs qui relèveront les défis de nos clients avec passion et persévérance jusqu'à ce que la bonne solution soit trouvée et qui s'épanouiront dans un environnement dynamique, collaboratif et passionnant.
 



 Pourquoi travailler avec Bosch Rexroth ?
 


* **Des projets stimulants** 
  : Nous sommes motivés par l'innovation et par le fait d'être à la pointe de tout ce que nous faisons. Chez Bosch Rexroth, chaque jour est différent et votre temps sera rempli de projets intéressants et passionnants.
* **Des collègues extraordinaires** 
 : Nos collaborateurs font de nous ce que nous sommes, et nous sommes très fiers de la diversité et de la compétence de notre équipe mondiale. Le fait d'être entouré d'une équipe qui vous soutient et vous encourage peut faire toute la différence.
* **Apprentissage et développement** 
  : Nous voulons que vous atteigniez votre plein potentiel, tant pour vous que pour Bosch Rexroth. C'est pourquoi nous encourageons activement la croissance et le développement.
* **Changer le monde :** 
  Nous voulons vous donner l'opportunité non seulement de faire avancer votre carrière mais aussi de changer le monde. Le travail que nous faisons chez Bosch Rexroth peut faire une grande différence dans le monde qui vous entoure.
* **Social et axé sur la valeur** 
  : Nous avons pour tradition d'assumer notre responsabilité sociale dans tout ce que nous faisons. Notre succès et notre feuille de route pour l'avenir reposent sur les valeurs que nous avons vécues. Celles\\-ci couvrent tous les domaines, de la communauté à l'environnement, en passant par le fait d'être un employeur social.
* **Flexibilité et liberté** 
  : Nous nous efforçons de vous offrir un équilibre entre votre vie professionnelle et votre vie privée, ainsi que la liberté de faire avancer votre carrière.
* **Opportunités internationales** 
 : Nous sommes une entreprise véritablement mondiale, dotée d'un réseau complet et présente dans plus de 80 pays à travers le monde.



 Our drive and control technologies ensure efficient, powerful and safe movement in machines and systems of any size. We inspire our customers with intelligent components, tailored system solutions, and services – from fully connected applications to the factory of the future. Bosch Rexroth is dedicated to making the world a better place through innovation and technology. We are looking for associates who will take on our customers’ challenges with passion and persistence until the right solution is found and who will thrive in a face\\-paced, collaborative and exciting environment.
 



 Why work with Bosch Rexroth?
 


* **Challenging Projects** 
 : We are driven by innovation and being at the cutting edge of everything that we do. At Bosch Rexroth every day is different and your time will be filled with interesting and exciting projects.
* **Amazing Colleagues:** 
  Our people make us who we are, and we are very proud of our diverse and skilled global team. Having a supportive and encouraging team around you can make all the difference.
* **Learning and Development:** 
 We want you to reach your fullest potential, for both yourself and for Bosch Rexroth. That’s why we actively promote growth and development.
* **Change the World:** 
  We want to give you the opportunity to not only drive your career forward but also to change the world. The work we do at Bosch Rexroth can make a big difference to the world around you.
* **Social \\& Value\\-Driven:** 
  We have a tradition of assuming social responsibility in all that we do. Our success, and our roadmap for the  future, is based on our lived values. This covers everything, from community to the environment, to being a social employer.
* **Flexibility \\& Freedom:** 
 We strive to give you a balance between your work and home life, as well as the freedom to drive your career forward.
* **International Opportunities:** 
  We are a truly global, fully networked company, with locations in more than 80 countries all over the world.


 Job Description
   

  


 En tant que responsable du développement des comptes, vous serez chargé de promouvoir et de vendre avec succès les solutions, produits et services hydrauliques industrielle de Bosch Rexroth sur un territoire défini. Les tâches et responsabilités comprennent ;
 


* Utiliser des techniques de vente à valeur ajoutée pour comprendre les activités de nos clients et proposer des solutions qui améliorent l'offre de nos clients, en veillant à ce que Bosch Rexroth soit un partenaire commercial privilégié.
* Vendre efficacement les produits et services de l'entreprise par des contacts planifiés et réguliers avec les clients et des visites sur le terrain.
* Proposer des solutions techniques aux clients, le cas échéant.
* Négocier des contrats et examiner les conditions commerciales conformément aux règles convenues en matière de remises et de marges.
* Préparer des devis et des spécifications détaillés en veillant à ce que les exigences du client soient satisfaites.
* Assurer la documentation en temps utile des données pertinentes en organisant et en maintenant l'interaction avec les clients dans le système de gestion de la relation client de la société, ROBIN. (par exemple, les coordonnées des clients, les informations sur l'entreprise, les rapports de visite, la gestion des opportunités, etc.) conformément aux attentes minimales d'utilisation.
* Produire et développer des rapports mensuels d'informations commerciales pour soutenir les contrôles du département et les améliorations des performances conformément aux normes de l'entreprise et aux exigences en matière de rapports.
* Collaborer régulièrement avec les autres membres de l'équipe, du département et de l'entreprise afin d'assurer un flux d'informations rapide et réciproque et de contribuer à un travail d'équipe efficace.
* Travailler à tous les niveaux avec les clients existants et potentiels afin de comprendre leurs activités et d'identifier leurs plans d'affaires futurs, en veillant à ce que Bosch Rexroth soit le meilleur partenaire possible pour répondre à leurs besoins futurs.
* Autres tâches en fonction des besoins



 As the Account Development Manager, you will be responsible for successfully promoting and value selling of Bosch Rexroth Industrial Hydraulic solutions, products and services into a defined territory. Duties and responsibilities include;
 


* Utilizing value\\-selling techniques to understand our customers’ businesses and offer solutions that both enhance and improve our customers’ offering, ensuring Bosch Rexroth is a preferred business partner.
* Effectively selling company products and services through planned and regular customer contact and field visits.
* Proposing technical system solutions to customers as required.
* Negotiating contracts and reviewing commercial terms and conditions in line with agreed discount and margin rules.
* Preparing detailed quotations and specifications ensuring customer requirements are fulfilled
* Ensuring timely documenting of relevant data by organizing and maintaining customer interaction within the companies CRM system, ROBIN. (e.g. customer contact details, company information, visit reporting, opportunity management etc.) in line with minimum expectations of use.
* Producing and developing business information monthly reports to support department controls and performance improvements in line with company standards and reporting requirements
* Collaborating regularly with other members of the team, department and business to ensure rapid two\\-way flow of information and contribution to effective teamwork.
* Working at all levels with existing and prospective customers to understand their business and identify their future business plans, ensuring Bosch Rexroth is the best possible partner to support their future needs.
* Other duties as assigned


 Qualifications
   

  


**Formation** 



* Ingénieur/Technologue en mécanique (ou équivalent).
* Un diplôme en commerce est un atout, mais n'est pas nécessaire.



**Expérience/compétences** 



* Le bilinguisme (français et anglais) est requis.
* Plus de 5 ans d'expérience en vente/marketing dans la promotion de produits connexes auprès de comptes industriels
* Solides connaissances techniques et aptitudes ; forte compréhension de l'industrie de l'hydraulique
* Forte compréhension de la vente à valeur ajoutée
* Solides compétences en matière de communication et d'écoute ; empathie à l'égard des besoins d'autrui ; compétences organisationnelles, y compris en matière de gestion de projets.
* Compétences informatiques suffisantes pour organiser les données et préparer les présentations.
* Professionnel de la vente certifié (ou équivalent)
* Compréhension financière des états et des indicateurs clés de performance et lien avec l'impact opérationnel (matrice à déterminer)
* Sens élevé de l'urgence et de l'orientation client
* Capacité à créer une vision et à fixer des objectifs
* Autonomie et dynamisme
* Esprit d'équipe, capacité à motiver les autres



**Education** 



* Mechanical Engineer/Technologist (or equivalent).
* Business degree is an asset, but not required



**Experience/skills** 



* Bilingual (French \\& English) is required
* 5\\+ years of sales/marketing experience in promoting related products to industrial accounts
* Strong technical background and aptitude; strong understanding of the hydraulics industry
* Strong understanding of value\\-added selling
* Strong, effective communication and listening skills; Empathic to the needs of others; organizational skills including project management
* Sufficient computer skills to organize data and prepare presentations
* Certified Sales Professional (or equivalent)
* Financial understanding of statements and KPIs and link to operational impact (matrix to be determined)
* High sense of urgency and customer focus
* Effective at creating vision and goal setting
* Self\\-starter and driver
* Team player, able to motivate others


  

  

 Additional Information
   

  


 Par choix, nous nous engageons envers une main\\-d'œuvre diversifiée et sommes un employeur garantissant l'égalité des chances. Bosch Rexroth accueille et encourage les candidatures de personnes handicapées. Des aménagements sont disponibles sur demande pour les candidats prenant part au processus de sélection.
 



 By choice, we are committed to a diverse workforce and are an equal opportunity employer. Bosch Rexroth welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in the selection process.

title: Senior C++ Programmer - Machine Learning   Content Creation Technology Group
description:
Job Description
   

  


 The Content Creation Technology Group (CCTG) is looking for a Senior AI/ML Programmer who will contribute to the development of applications in the domains of Generative AI and ML bots. The Senior AI/ML Programmer role will bring best practices and design principles to assist the team in delivering our ambitious features roadmap. 
 



  
 



**Main responsibilities:** 



* Provide and support ML systems based on business requirements and objectives.


* Establish technical designs to meet game’s needs.


* Collaborate with the data science team, specialized programmers (gameplay, AI, etc.), the research team, and other stakeholders such as productions.


* Develop, integrate, and maintain inference engines, libraries, and ML frameworks.


* Leverage best hardware (NPU, GPU, CPU) to accelerate ML related computations


* Develop systems that allow Gameplay programmers and Data scientist to easily track relevant data to train models


* Develop systems to benchmark, evaluate and optimize model’s performance


* Program in a clear and structured manner that is in keeping with performance, maintenance, modularity, scalability and compatibility requirements


* Integrate and maintain ML systems in game engines and games.


* Write unit tests and integration tests



  
 



**Other responsibilities:** 



* Creating proof of concepts, that can require model training, fine tuning, experimenting with different techniques and models.


* Suggest improvements whenever necessary by designing and implementing new systems or enhancing existing ones


* Conducting research to stay up to date with the latest advancements.


* Documentation, presentations, and knowledge sharing to communicate complex AI concepts to both technical and non\\-technical collaborators.


 Qualifications
   

  


**Education:** 




 Bachelor’s degree in computer science or computer engineering or equivalent. Master in Machine Learning is an asset. 
 



  
 



**Relevant Experience:** 




 Minimum 5 years’ experience in AI/ML. 
 



  
 



**Core Skills:** 



* In\\-depth knowledge of C\\+\\+ required


* Strong Architecture skills


* A good hardware knowledge, to take advantage of multithreading, and optimize memory management.



  
 



**Other Skills:** 



* Proficient in Python is an asset.


* Experience working with game engines is an asset.


* A good knowledge of Database products is an asset.


* A good knowledge of cloud\\-based platforms is an asset.


* A good knowledge of machine learning and deep learning fundamentals.

title: Data Scientist, Credit Risk
description:
The Credit Risk Strategy Department develops and implements credit risk decision\\-making strategies based on risk/return quantification to deliver value for the organization as well as members and clients while safeguarding Desjardins Group's long\\-term survival. As a Credit Risk Data Scientist, you help meet needs associated to a credit risk assessment related to the granting and life cycle of financing products. You lead practitioners on projects that develop and use credit strategies for the institution's business activities. You serve as a specialist advisor, resource person and coach for the team and business partners. You'll be required to:
 


* Design, use and develop decision\\-making strategies for credit management and diligently prepare associated documentation.
* Build innovative algorithms to evolve our risk strategies.
* Support the transformation of credit risk strategies and maximize their financial impact.
* Balance business needs, risk management, requirements and best practices.
* Lead or contribute to projects, mandates or activities in your field of expertise.
* Serve as a specialist in your field of expertise for units in the organization and practitioners. Explain information in plain language and based on the target audience in order to facilitate comprehension and, if applicable, decision making.
* Monitor the industry to understand and anticipate trends in your field of expertise to develop and update relevant best practices for the organization.







**What we offer\\*** 



* Competitive salary and annual bonus
* 4 weeks of flexible vacation starting in the first year
* Defined benefit pension plan that provides predictable, stable income throughout retirement
* Group insurance including telemedicine
* Reimbursement of health and wellness expenses and telework equipment



*\\* Benefits apply based on eligibility criteria.* 








**What you bring to the table** 



* Bachelor's degree in math, statistics, economics, finance or a related field
* A minimum of six years of relevant experience
* Please note that other combinations of qualifications and relevant experience may be considered
* Machine learning experience: Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and their application in credit risk management
* Experience in credit risk management and quantification
* Knowledge of French is required
* Intermediate knowledge of English due to the nature of the duties or work tools or because the position involves interactions with English\\-speaking partners, members and/or clients
* Proficiency with SAS, SQL and Python programming tools


 Innovation
 
















 \\#LI\\-Hybrid
 







**Trade Union (If applicable)** 












 At Desjardins, we believe in equity, diversity and inclusion. title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Notre client est à la recherche des Ingénieurs Logiciels Seniors passionnés. Postes permanents, salaires annuels estimés environ 100000 à 120000 par an selon notre cabinet. 2 à 3 jours bureau à Montréal.
   



  

**Tâches :** 
 Collaborer avec l’équipe pour concevoir, développer et améliorer un nouveau module de leur plateforme, en intervenant sur l’ensemble du stack technologique pour proposer des solutions web robustes et évolutives.
   



  


* Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les chefs de produit et les designers afin d’optimiser les fonctionnalités et les parcours utilisateurs, garantissant une expérience fluide et intuitive.
* Appliquer les meilleures pratiques en développement logiciel, notamment l’intégration et le déploiement continus (CI/CD) ainsi que des tests de qualité intégrés.
* Participer aux discussions techniques de l’équipe pour assurer l’alignement sur les objectifs produit et les implémentations techniques.
* Écrire un code propre, maintenable et bien documenté afin d’accompagner l’évolution de la plateforme.
   

 Être en contact direct avec leurs clients afin de garantir que les solutions développées dépassent leurs attentes.



  



**Environnement technologique** 
  




* **Backend** 
 : Java 21 (Spring)
* **Frontend** 
 : Angular 18\\+ (TypeScript)
* **Autres technologies** 
 : Python, AWS, PostgreSQL, Redis, Docker



 \\-\\-
   



  



  



 The company is seeking Senior Software Engineers for permanent, full\\-time positions with estimated annual salaries of $100,000 to $120,000\\. The job requires 2 to 3 days of office work in Montreal. The main tasks include collaborating with the team to design and develop a new platform module, working across the technology stack to deliver scalable web solutions. The role also involves working closely with product managers and designers to optimize functionality and user experience. Adherence to software development best practices and continuous integration and deployment is expected, along with maintaining clean, well\\-documented code. Additionally, the engineers will be involved in technical discussions and maintaining direct contact with customers to ensure their expectations are exceeded. The technological environment includes Java 21 (Spring) for the backend, Angular 18\\+ (TypeScript) for the frontend, as well as Python, AWS, PostgreSQL, Redis, and Docker.
   


  

 Profil
 * **4 ans d’expérience** 
 ou plus en développement logiciel.

 **mentorer** 
 les nouveaux talents et les ingénieurs juniors.
* Expérience en développement backend, idéalement avec
 **Java et Spring Boot** 
 (ou technologies similaires).

 **TypeScript et Angular** 
 (ou un autre framework moderne équivalent).
* Connaissance des bonnes pratiques modernes en développement logiciel (
 **TDD, BDD, architecture hexagonale** 
 ).
* Expérience avec
 **AWS** 
 ou d’autres plateformes cloud.
* **Maîtrise de l’anglais à l’oral.**



**Atouts supplémentaires** 
  




* Intérêt ou expérience en
 **Machine Learning** 
 .
* Expérience approfondie avec
 **AWS** 
 .



 \\-\\-
   



  



 4 or more years of software development experience.
   





  





 Motivation and enthusiasm to mentor new talent and junior engineers.
   





  





 Backend development experience, ideally with Java and Spring Boot (or similar technologies).
   





  





 Frontend development experience, preferably with TypeScript and Angular (or other equivalent modern framework).
   





  





 Knowledge of modern software development best practices (TDD, BDD, hexagonal architecture).
   





  





 Experience with AWS or other cloud platforms.
   





  





 Fluency in spoken English.
   





  





  





 Additional Benefits Interest or experience in machine learning.
   





  





 Strong experience with AWS.
   





  


  

 Informations contractuelles
 * Salaire attractif \\+ bonus annuel \\+ avantages \\*\\*\\*\\*\\*
* Assurance santé, dentaire et vision.
* Plan d’épargne retraite.
* Politique de congés généreuse.
* Indemnités de transport.
* Abonnement à une salle de sport via ClassPass.

 \\-\\-Attractive salary \\+ annual bonus \\+ benefits \\*\\*\\*\\*\\*

 Retirement savings plan.
   



  



 Generous leave policy.

title: Senior Technical Product Manager - Data & ML Platform
description:
**Drive Coveo towards innovation and relevance!** 

 As a Senior Technical Product Manager for the Data \\& ML Platform, you'll play a critical role in shaping Coveo's data and machine learning infrastructure. Our AI\\-powered platform relies on cutting\\-edge data acquisition, processing, and storage architectures to deliver intelligent, real\\-time experiences to end\\-users. Your mission? Define a technology vision and roadmap to propel our platform into the future.
 



 If you're excited about enabling R\\&D teams to build the right solutions, collaborating across foundational R\\&D units, and equipping product teams with the data and ML capabilities they need to push our competitive edge—let's talk!
 


**Here's what makes this opportunity exciting:** 

 Coveo is a leader in AI\\-driven relevance, helping global enterprises optimize digital experiences. Our Data Platform ingests vast amounts of data, transforms it into actionable insights, and fuels our AI\\-powered solutions. In this role, you will drive innovation, scalability, and cost\\-effectiveness across our data and ML stack, impacting the entire organization.
 



 If you're passionate about bridging the gap between data, ML, and business impact, this is your chance to make a real difference!
 


**Here's what you'll be responsible for:** 
* Defining and driving the product roadmap for Coveo's Data \\& ML Platform, ensuring alignment with business goals and technical vision.
* Researching industry trends and customer needs to inform product decisions and prioritize impactful initiatives.
* Collaborating with internal stakeholders—engineering, product, and business teams—to provide reliable and scalable data solutions.
* Partnering with Product Marketing and Customer Success to effectively communicate data changes and mitigate customer impact.
* Advocating for data self\\-serve models and ML platform capabilities that empower teams across Coveo.


**Here's what will qualify you for the role:** 
* 5\\+ years of product management experience in a SaaS environment, with deep expertise in data ingestion pipelines, data platforms, cloud solutions (ideally AWS), and ML infrastructure.
* Familiarity with cloud\\-based data storage, transformation, and governance solutions such as Snowflake or Databricks.
* Strong analytical mindset, with the ability to define and measure success through data\\-driven metrics, and excellent communication skills, enabling alignment between technical and non\\-technical stakeholders.


**Here's what will make you stand out from the crowd:** 
* You thrive in a fast\\-paced, innovative environment and excel at translating technical challenges into strategic opportunities.
* You have hands\\-on experience with large\\-scale data processing, ML workflows, or AI\\-driven analytics.
* You're passionate about fostering collaboration between data teams, engineers, and business leaders.



 Do you think you can bring this role to life?
   

 You don't need to check every single box—passion goes a long way, and we appreciate that skillsets are transferable. We want to hear from you!
 



 Join the
 **Coveolife** 
 !
 



*We encourage all qualified candidates to apply, regardless of age, gender, disability, gaps in CV, or national or ethnic background. We know that applying for a new role takes time, and we truly appreciate your effort.* 




*\\#li\\-hybrid \\#li\\-remote*

title: Developpeur Logiciel // Software developer
description:
Tu es passionne par les nouvelles technologies, et tu souhaites faire partie d'une equipe de developpement logiciel en constante quete d'innovation dans un cadre chaleureux, decontracte et stimulant ?
   

 Nous recherchons un coequipier comme toi !
   

 Joins\\-toi a une equipe Agile et ambitieuse qui a la volonte de toujours s'ameliorer et de developper des applications innovantes au sein de notre plateforme qui aide les radiodiffuseurs, les podcasters et les services musicaux a maximiser leurs revenus en ligne.
 



**Tes responsabilites** 
 :
 
* Contribuer a la conception et au developpement de nouvelles fonctionnalites et a l'amelioration/correction de fonctionnalites existantes.
* Ecrire du code de qualite pour developper et maintenir des applications robustes utilisees a grande echelle.
* Collaborer avec le Product Owner et interagir avec les autres equipes de produits afin de definir les solutions du futur de l'organisation.
* Contribuer a toutes les activites du cycle de developpement d'applications (planification, conception, codage, revue de code, tests unitaires/automatises, documentation, deploiement, operations, surveillance et alertes).
* Demontrer de l'ouverture aux idees des autres tout en communiquant avec respect.
* Proposer et aider a la mise en uvre de solutions d'amelioration continue.
* Etre un membre engage, transparent et positif dans une equipe Agile auto\\-organisee et multidisciplinaire.
* Recommander certains choix technologiques et etre en mesure de les supporter.



**Tu es un excellent candidat si** 
 :
 
* Tu as une bonne connaissance du langage de programmation Scala ou
* Tu as une bonne connaissance de Java et un interet pour apprendre un langage de developpement fonctionnel comme Scala.
* Tu as des connaissances au sujet des conteneurs Docker.
* Tu souhaites mieux comprendre les systemes de manipulation de flux de donnees (Kafka).
* Tu as un bon sens de l'analyse et tu es capable de communiquer tes idees.
* Tu as au moins deux annees d'experiences professionnelles en tant que developpeur.
* \\*Tu parles anglais a un niveau professionnel.



**Atouts:** 

* Tu as experimente des techniques de developpement par les tests (TDD) et tu connais certains outils d'integration et de deploiement continus.
* Tu as de l'experience avec les principes de developpement S.O.L.I.D.
* Tu as de l'experience avec Kafka.
* Tu connais des outils comme GitHub Actions, ArgoCD, Grafana et Kubernetes.



 \\*L'utilisation de l'anglais est necessaire pour collaborer avec des collegues internationaux, pour acceder a des informations et des ressources et pour communiquer a l'echelle internationale.
 

 \\*\\*\\*\\*
 


 Are you passionate about new technologies, and would you like to be part of a software development team constantly seeking innovation in a warm, relaxed, and stimulating environment?
   

 We're looking for a teammate like you!
   

 Join an Agile and ambitious team that is driven to always improve and develop innovative applications within our platform that help broadcasters, podcasters and music services maximize their online revenue.
 



**Your responsibilities** 
 :
 
* Contribute to the design and development of new features and the improvement/correction of existing features.
* Write quality code to develop and maintain robust applications used at scale.
* Collaborate with the Product Owner and interact with other product teams to define solutions for the future of the organization.
* Contribute to all activities of the application development lifecycle (planning, design, coding, code review, unit/automated testing, documentation, deployment, operations, monitoring, and alerting).
* Demonstrate openness to the ideas of others while communicating with respect.
* Propose and help implement continuous improvement solutions.
* Be an engaged, transparent, and positive member of a self\\-organizing and multidisciplinary Agile team.
* Recommend certain technological choices and be able to support them.



**You are an excellent candidate if:** 

* You have a good knowledge of the Scala programming language or
* You have a good knowledge of Java and an interest in learning a functional development language like Scala.
* You know Docker containers.
* You want to better understand distributed event streaming platforms like Kafka.
* You have good analytical skills and can communicate your ideas.
* You have at least two years of professional experience as a developer.
* You are bilingual (French \\& English).



**Assets:** 

* You have experimented with test\\-driven development (TDD) techniques and are familiar with some continuous integration and deployment tools.
* You have experience with the principles of S.O.L.I.D development.
* You have experience with Kafka.
* You know tools like GitHub Actions, ArgoCD, Grafana, and Kubernetes.



 Employment Type: Full\\-Time

title: Senior Machine Learning Data Scientist
description:
**Senior Machine Learning Data Scientist** 




  





 We're on the hunt for a
 **Senior Machine Learning Data Scientist** 
 to help us create smarter, more realistic AI bots for player simulations. Think: next\\-level gaming experiences powered by cutting\\-edge ML tech. You'll join a creative, data\\-loving team pushing the limits of what AI can do in gaming.
 



  





 What you’ll do:
 



  




* Train \\& fine\\-tune ML models
* Analyze player data to improve gameplay

 What you bring:
